title: How to Wear a Waist Trainer

steps.title: Pick a design.
steps.content: Pick a design. Most waist trainers have several rows of hooks and eyes. A few have an extra zipper, which can tighten up your trainer even more. If you prefer, you can also get a smaller band that just goes around your waist and attaches with hook-and-loop fastener. You can find these styles at stores that sell multiple brands, such as Hourglass Angels. You can also find waist trainers with straps at the top, and a few also have built-in bras.

steps.title: Choose the lowest setting.
steps.content: Choose the lowest setting. Most trainers have 2 to 3 rows of hooks, so use the looser setting at first. You need to work up to the tighter setting; it could be very uncomfortable if you don't. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Put the trainer on.
steps.content: Put the trainer on. This step can be a little difficult if you've never done it. You may need to suck in your breath or lie down. While you're holding your breath or lying down, connect the hooks to each other to secure the trainer on your body. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Find clothing to hide it.
steps.content: Find clothing to hide it. In general, any kind of lightweight or sheer clothing will show the waist trainer underneath it. Similarly, any kind of crop top will let the trainer peek out underneath. [3] X Research source You may want to wear looser, heavier clothing when wearing the waist trainer. [4] X Research source For instance, you could wear a light suit or a sweater to help hide the waist trainer. Go for heavier fabrics, such as wool or knit fabrics, rather than silk or other lightweight fabrics.

steps.title: Wear it throughout the day.
steps.content: Wear it throughout the day. A waist trainer is meant to be worn just during the day for a certain number of hours. Some people just wear it to work, for instance. However, how long you wear it is up to you. [5] X Research source Some guides recommend 8 to 10 hours a day, but you can wear it less if it's making you uncomfortable. [6] X Research source It usually takes a couple of weeks to notice results if you're wearing your waist trainer consistently. [7] X Expert Source Souad Gharib Exercise & Wellness Specialist Expert Interview. 8 June 2021. Once you start noticing results, you can size down to a smaller waist trainer as needed. [8] X Expert Source Souad Gharib Exercise & Wellness Specialist Expert Interview. 8 June 2021.

steps.title: Take it off if you don't feel comfortable.
steps.content: Take it off if you don't feel comfortable. You should expect some discomfort with a waist trainer. However, if you feel very uncomfortable, you should remove it to find some relief.

steps.title: Remove it to sleep.
steps.content: Remove it to sleep. Waist trainers are not meant to be worn at night. In fact, it's best to take it off when you get home from work. You need to give your body a chance to relax and recover. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Measure your waist with a flexible tape measure.
steps.content: Measure your waist with a flexible tape measure. Wrap it around your waist halfway between your ribs and hips, making sure to measure against bare skin. Check the measurement, and write the number down. [10] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source You can also use a string if you don't have a flexible tape measure. Wrap it around your waist, and mark the point where it crosses itself. Hold it against a flat tape measure or measuring stick.

steps.title: Find a waist trainer online.
steps.content: Find a waist trainer online. You may be able to find a waist trainer at high-end sporting good stores, since some people wear them while working out. However, your best bet is likely to be online. You can find trainers at places like Hourglass Angel, Ann Chery, and Yianna. [11] X Research source Typically, waist trainers start at $50 USD and go up from there.

steps.title: Match your measurements to the perfect size.
steps.content: Match your measurements to the perfect size. Even if the website displays your typical size, it's a good idea to compare your waist measurement to the sizing chart. Getting the right size for a waist trainer is more important than with other clothing. When in doubt, go up a size.

steps.title: Consult your doctor first.
steps.content: Consult your doctor first. Because the waist trainer can cause medical problems, it's a good idea to talk to your doctor before you start wearing one. They can advise as to whether it's a good fit for you.

steps.title: Be careful how much you eat.
steps.content: Be careful how much you eat. It's a bad idea to eat too much in a waist trainer. If you do, you'll find yourself very uncomfortable. If you do want to eat a large meal, consider taking the trainer off. [12] X Research source Some suggest that this aspect is a benefit of waist training. That is, you can't eat too much while wearing it, so you may lose weight that way.

steps.title: Work out in addition to waist training.
steps.content: Work out in addition to waist training. While waist training can reduce the size of your waist, it may also weaken your core muscles since it provides exterior support. [13] X Research source Plus, it's not actually causing you to lose any fat . Therefore, if you really want to permanently reduce the size of your waist, you need to work out regularly, doing both aerobic exercises and strength training. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Skip using a waist trainer while working out.
steps.content: Skip using a waist trainer while working out. Waist trainers reduce your ability to breathe deeply, which means you may not want to work as hard. Plus, you won't be able to move as well as you can without it.

steps.title: Take it off if you experience problems.
steps.content: Take it off if you experience problems. Extended waist training can lead to a variety of problems. For instance, you may notice increased acid reflux. You may also get light-headed and even pass out. Overtime, it can damage your ribs if you're not careful. [15] X Research source Stop wearing it if you experience these problems.
